title: As a long term Nasus main since s2, I think it's time to rework Nasus
body:
There's just no reason to play him anymore. Everything he hopes to do with farm is done better and more consistently by other fighters. In the past, when fighters were good, the upside of managing to get farm on Nasus was god tier mode late game with a 95% AS/MS slow, incredibly hard to kill, 700 range on wither and great front lining.

This was season 2 Nasus and the rewards were worth the risk of you managed to get farm. But since then, a lot of things have changed. He's been nerfed hard and never compensated one bit for any of those nerfs. The game has become ridiculously even more mobile while also granting these mobile champions CC to kite and stay away from Nasus indefinitely. He has no means to drain tank front lines because armor stackers on front lines reduce the effectiveness of Lifesteal meaning his one source of recovering health is heavily countered. The 600 HP on ult he gets is just another auto attack from a full build carry. He has no defensive steroids, no mobility, his strengths have been stripped away and he's a shell of his former self. It's why he hasn't been picked at all this season in competitive play and won't be.

I am convinced at this point, a rework is much better than buffs. The only thing I see buffs doing is pushing him to a point where he's just a wall of stats you can't overcome and quite frankly, that's bullshit. I don't want my champion to be Irelia 2.0. And honestly, when he has been good, that's kind of what he was. So I can't see a scenario where you buff him with his current kit and put him in a state where he's worth playing unless you buff him so hard, he just becomes a walking wall of destruction you can't deal with. Riot has gone away from that concept and has for awhile.

I am convinced you can keep his stacking Q mechanic in place. It doesn't even necessarily have to be an infinite stacking mechanic but it does need to be something worth stacking because at his core, that is his identity. Wither as a point and click disable probably just needs to go, I suspect you can turn this spell more into a mobility/MS boost spell that is granted additional effects from other spells - as an example, if Nasus casts wither on you and hits you with Q, your AD is reduced by 15% or something along those lines while having a different spell effect with E. I think his ult is honestly fine as it is, it was a spell that was honestly ahead of its time when it was made. I also think a HP% return on his W isn't out of the question so he can actually drain tank front lines in some facet.

I suspect this won't be popular amongst other Nasus mains, but the truth is after playing a lot of Jax lately, I just see no reason to ever play Nasus again. It's too frustrating. And I hate that because he's my favorite champion and I just want him to be good but not overbearing. And I just don't see a way his current kit can ever be good without it being overtuned as hell to compensate for how much this game has indirectly shit on his existence with CC/mobility galore attatched to every kit.

I also realize he's not even close to a priority to rework because there are others who've waited much longer and need it just as much, if not more. And they've been in line much longer, too. But I am at a point where I see no other options for him other than a full-on rework.

Whether they're balanced or not isn't the point, the point is that they are _intended_ to be giant walking walls of destruction that are simultaneously supertanks and damage dealers. When they're strong or ahead, they're not like ADCs or mages that you can catch out of position, CC, and burst down, you have to spend tons of time and resources chain-CCing them and slowly burning them down, and if they have their team with them they become impossible to deal with. Hm... I'll brainstorm a few ideas. All random suggestions that have nothing to do with each other.
---
#Passive
+ **Truesteal** - Basically like the new WotA, his basic attacks and Q will proc lifesteal equal to the amount of damage he would have done before resistances. Only problem with this is that it kills some of the synergy with Hydra. Perhaps have him apply it on all physical damage dealt then? Anyway, moving on.
+ **Completely New Passive?** - removal of this passive in favor of a new one (possibly move this one to Q if it is absolutely needed).

#Q
+ **Added Cripple Effect** - If you've spent awhile on these boards you may have heard this suggestion tossed around a few times. Basically what it does is temporarily disable the afflicted target's dash/blink/self-displacement abilities. This definitely would not belong on Wither, that'd just make Wither broken. It'd be more balanced attached to Q. This effect would last 1 second and possibly have a rapidly decaying slow _(talking like, from 30% -> 0% over 0.5 seconds or something)_ attached to it in order to emphasize and better communicate the fact that it cripples. _(Maybe have some sort of icon for it as well)_
+ **Cooldown Unaffected by CDR--Stacks Reduce CD** - This would open up more build paths to him, allowing him to diverge from FH and SV as mandatory rush items _(though CDR is only half the reason he builds those items, but still, more options)._ As to how much CDR is granted per stack I don't know, but it could tie into this:
+ **Gain New Effects in a Stack Tier System** - Effects like the above mentioned ones. Personally think they should come at the cost of some damage on Q or perhaps just a limit on Q's max damage.

#W
+ **Remove** - Removing this would solve many problems, as you said, but this is such an iconic skill of his that I'd hate for it to come to that
+ **Wither Cloud** - As it sounds, it instead creates a controllable Wither pet cloud like Viktor's ult that increases the potency of the slow for every second a target remains in it. Size could increase with level. This will, however, remove its reliability as a targeted shut down ability. But maybe that's what's needed.
+ **Wither AoE** - Instantly applies Wither to all targets in cone/circular area/line in front of him. Would still be basically unavoidable, retaining the reliability of it but also allowing him to apply it to more targets. This would allow the potency of it _(raw slowing power)_ to be nerfed. Yup, that's where I was going with it. It's just way too strong as a single target ability but useless if it was a weaker single target ability. Making it AoE may just be what needs to be done.

#E
+ This is such a basic and good ability and somehow really iconic to him. I really don't think it should be touched.

#R
+ **Remove the Things in Bold** - "While Nasus is empowered, he deals magic damage to all enemies around him each second, **~~capped at 240,~~** and **~~gains bonus attack damage equal to 6.375% of the damage dealt, up to a maximum of 300 bonus AD.~~**"
+ + They both seem so unnecessary. One removes visible power while the other grants invisible power. Take both out and it'll just make more sense. Ofcourse, the % health damage would need to be looked at again.

Well, what's annoying with Nasus is that he's not really the good old lategame champion it once felt really good to play, because back then in season 2 he really had a trash laning phase. His manacosts were really high too. His laning was abysmal. But he was so good in lategame. But it was also the items, the champions... He felt actually really tanky and his wither was very strong against ADC's. Now it's easily dealable with a Mercurial or Crucible and the attack speed is slow is so much weaker than it used to be. Despite it being very obnoxious as a spell, his Wither kinda made him have a great teamfighting. He also used to take Shurelia to compensate his lack of mobility and it was very nice. Right now, tankiness is shit compared to what it was back then. There is true damage and %health everywhere, AD carries are super strong, crit itemization and AP itemization are very strong... Nasus is just plain bad in lategame teamfight, and it's really sad.

**However**, he's really viable right now. His laning is actually pretty strong, and his midgame is ridiculously strong if well farmed. He can put huge pressure by splitting and can teamfight midgame when people don't quite melt him or kite him too hard yet.

But it doesn't feel as fun as it did. When you play Nasus, you're looking to have a nightmarish laning with huge reward, and not really staying all game long top. You wanna be like, having a challenging laning but being able to come back huge in fights. Right now, you just split all game with a safe laning. It's sad

Well a big part of that was the calculation changes on resists. Back then, resist stacking made anything tanky, not so much now. Riot has done a fairly good job of granting true tanks a very good method of being innately durable with %reduction damage, resist steroids, shields and such. Nasus doesn't fit into any of this because at his core, he isn't a tank - he's a fighter. He's not going to be nearly as tanky as a true tank, nor should he be, but he doesn't offer much else either past a certain point. It's why I said a mechanic of %HP return on his Q vs champions isn't a bad idea, this means he can actually drain tank front lines.

Fighters destroy him in lane and rush BC, making his FH Rush significantly less effective. 3 patches ago, this mid game God tier level was a real thing and frankly it's always been that way since s3. But that simply isn't the case anymore. And more over, why even bother taking a risk to play a champ that loses to so many fighters when you can just pick a fighter and be more impactful more consistently? Again, there's just no reason to play him and the risk of playing him isn't worth the reward.

You wanna be like, having a challenging laning but being able to come back huge in fights. Right now, you just split all game with a safe laning. It's sad

At this point, even by mid game, he's likely going to be far more impactful than you are. So what are you even farming for? Just to become a salty split pusher and hope to make it to 45 minutes + where you can be so farmed you can just face tank towers? That's lame anyway you slice it.
